result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Jackson-Lamon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)3.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to Extended supervision shall be due no later than March 1, 2023 immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

05-18-2020/ Judge Michael Hanrahan
The Court ordered  that the defendant's request for additional sentence credit is granted in part.  The JOC shall be amended to include a TOTAL of 17 days of sentence credit.
****
Concurrent with: Concurrent to counts two, three and four; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 17 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No posession of more than one cell phone at at one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not work in a place where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
To comply with all child support Court orders.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

The court informed  the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 9741.29(1m) or (4m).
Court advised the defendat that under Wisconsin Statute 302.13 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, three, four; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 17 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two, four; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 17 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two, three; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 17 days.

Defendant Michael M Jackson-Lamon in court with attorney Daniel H Sanders.  Defendant Michael M Jackson-Lamon in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to count 1 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  8 YEARS with 16 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 2, 3, 4 and Consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.
As to count 2
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS/MONTHS with 16 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 1, 3, 4 and Consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 3
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  13 YEARS with 16 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 1, 2, 4 and Consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.
As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  13 YEARS with 16 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 1, 2, 3 and Consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.


Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
 Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due no later than March 1, 2023 immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 


- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 



- CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not work in a place where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

  
Filed;

Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael M Jackson-Lamon in court with attorney Daniel H Sanders.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 5: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 3, and 4 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 02-29-2016 at 08:30, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
